title_full:
La Roche

              —
              Liye Liye
            
              (Nyege Nyege Tapes)
label: Nyege Nyege Tapes
description:
'Liye Liye' is an outerzone burner, shifting Congolese sounds and soukous rhythms into a bleep techno milieu, flirting with grime's enduring exoskeleton. Tip!

La Roche's debut solo album establishes a series of releases on Nyege Nyege Tapes focusing on new music from the Democratic Republic of Congo. The producer is best known for his work with... more

title_full:
Nina Harker

              —
              Nina Harker
            
              (All Night Flight, Animal Biscuit, La République des Granges, Le Syndicat des Scorpions)
label: All Night Flight, Animal Biscuit, La République des Granges, Le Syndicat des Scorpions
description:
Extraordinary, wave-shaped, polyglot marvels by France’s Nina Harker; setting french, german, japanese, spanish, and greek language vocals to a wild garden of styles  - a must check for fans of Liaisons Dangereuses/CHBB, Hype Williams, Die Tödliche Doris, Saâda Bonaire, Cobra Killer, Lolina, Sterolab - basically just the sickest.

Free as fuck in the most... more

label: The Death Of Rave
description: Radical protagonist of “feral gore feminist ASMR”, Ronce delivers a truly shocking debut album based on the female form and the violence that comes with it: surveillance, self disgust, anger, touch, desire (or lack thereof). It’s no doubt among the most disturbing yet arresting pieces of experimental music released in recent years, highly recommended listening if... more

release: All the new generation Gqom Producers out of Durban.
title_full: All the new generation Gqom Producers out of Durban.

Hideki Umezawa & Andrew Pekler

              —
              Two Views Of Amami Oshima
            
              (Edições CN)
label: Edições CN
description: Humid and lush concrète excursions from acclaimed Japanese composer Hideki Umezawa and ambient tropicalia explorer Andrew Pekler, investigating audiovisual topographies with a fathoms-deep approach to soundscaping that sits somewhere between the GRM’S laboratory-controlled composition, Rhythm & Sound's vapor trails and the lush enviro-ambient... more

label: Blank Forms Editions
description: This deluxe boxed set of Graham Lambkin’s first four solo records includes an expansive 42-page book featuring unseen photos and reproductions of artworks as well as essays and anecdotal recollections providing fresh insight and divulging hermetic secrets by Ed Atkins, Mark Harwood, Matt Krefting, Lawrence Kumpf, Samara Lubelski, and Adrian Rew... more

label: AWESOME TAPES FROM AFRICA
description:
South African dancefloor scorchers from DJ Black Low, shared beyond the region for first time by the ever reliable Awesome Tapes From Africa

The internet is remaining tight lipped about this fella right now, but it ain’t hard to hear the serious dancefloor levels across ‘Uwami’, working to the side of Amapiano and Gqom styles with lip-bitingly tight Afro-house... more

title_full:
Death Is Not The End

              —
              London Pirate Radio Adverts 1984-1993, Vol. 1
            
              (Death Is Not The End)
label: Death Is Not The End
description: oh my dayz this is unreal, keeling levels of radio and rave nostalgia with a cherry-picked volley of adverts from London pirate radio 1984-1993 somewhere between Mark Leckey’s Fiorucci Made Me Hardcore, Lee Gamble's 'Diversions' and Sublime Frequencies’ best radio surveys, except focussed much closer to home to capture an era that now seems like an... more

label: Valley Of Search
description:
Mesmerising solo debut of works for mallet percussion from Brooklyn’s Patricia Brennan, crossing our paths for first time and recalling very classy works from CC Hennix to Miles Davis, Terry Plumeri and Michael Ranta

You can colour us enchanted with ‘Maquishti’, which introduces the Mexican born, NYC-based vibraphonist, marimbist, improvisor and composer... more

label: Fridman Gallery
description:
Extraordinary debut study on race and sexual politics in the USA from emergent composer and Harvard music professor Yvette Janine Jackson, yielding an unmissable introduction to her immersive style of electro-acoustic composition and radioplay opera forms - RIYL Matana Roberts, John Cage, Terre Thaemlitz,  Sun Ra.

Contrasting one side of haunting... more

title_full:
Teresa Winter

              —
              Motto Of The Wheel
            
              (The Death Of Rave)
label: The Death Of Rave
description:
Teresa Winter returns with a definitive new album of lush, feverish rave mutations, dream-pop and ambient noise that’s highly recommended if yr feeling Cosey, A.R. Kane, A Guy Called Gerald, Laila Sakini.

'Motto Of The Wheel’ is a supernaturally compelling, definitive opus providing a life-giving bounty of warped ‘90s rave mutations, dream-pop and ambient... more

title_full:
Svitlana Nianio & Oleksandr Yurchenko

              —
              Znayesh Yak? Rozkazhy
            
              (Night School)
label: Night School
description:
Exquisite neo-folk from Kiev Ukraine, 1995, dropping on the mind’s eye like freezer-fresh LSD to conjure bucolic imagery fraught with a frazzled, hyaline tension that could snap either way. So good this one.

"Svitlana Nianio and Oleksandr Yurchenko are musicians with a long history in the still-mysterious Kiev Underground. Nianio’s first group Cukor Bela... more

title_full:
ANTHONY MANNING

              —
              Islets In Pink Polypropylene (Half Speed Master)
            
              (Mental Groove / Irdial Discs)
label: Half Speed Master
description:
Absolutely classic, innovative and experimental exercise in minimalism from 1994, originally releassed on the legendary Irdial label and now reissued via this essential half-speed re-master. It was an album so painstaking to make that Anthony Manning didnt have a proper night's sleep for weeks on end during its recording...

label: West Mineral
description:
Over a year since we last heard from them, Huerco S’ West Mineral imprint shimmers into view for their first release of 2021 -  a lush, jittery high of aerosolised ambient thizz and top shelf electroid steppers from Ben Bondy, highly recommended if yr into Perila, Jan Jelinek, Second Woman, Kindohm or Uon.
